Disease.Name: METHEMOGLOBINEMIA TYPE IV
Disease.Summary: rare;autosomal recessive;mutation in the microsomal cytochrome b5 gene (CYB5A);Type I: most frequent, ; methemoglobin concentration 10-35% ;Type II:; is progressive and leads to shortened lifespan;, 10% of individuals;Type IV: ;Methemoglobin concentration 12 to 19%

literature.title: A splicing mutation in the cytochrome b5 gene from a patient with congenital methemoglobinemia and pseudohermaphrodism
literature.author: Giordano SJ,

literature.title: Congenital methemoglobinemia with a deficiency of cytochrome b5
literature.author: Hegesh E,
